  • Method Details

    • showAuthenticators

      @MainThread public abstract void showAuthenticators(List<Fido2AuthenticatorInfo> authenticators, AuthenticatorSelectionCallback callback) throws Fido2Exception
      Called when there is more than one authenticator matches the policy specified in FIDO2 request. The authenticators are represented as single-dimensional array. This Single-dimensional array can be seen as a list of sets. Elements within a set indicate that multiple authenticators are used for verification. If this function is not implemented, the first set of the list will be selected. It is called on the main thread.
      Parameters:
      authenticators - Single-dimensional array containing authenticators that matches the policy.
      callback - The callback which will be implemented and passed in by FIDO2 SDK to receive the result
      Throws:
      Fido2Exception - thrown when authenticators given are not applicable. (e.g. not enrolled).
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • retrieveAuthenticatorDescription

      @MainThread public abstract void retrieveAuthenticatorDescription(Fido2AuthenticatorInfo selectedAuthenticator, AuthenticatorDescriptionCallback callback)
      Called when there is a need to provide a custom authenticator description. It is called on the main thread.
      Parameters:
      selectedAuthenticator - Information of the selected authenticator.
      callback - The callback which will be implemented and passed in by FIDO2 SDK to receive the result
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • showTransactionDetails

      @MainThread public abstract void showTransactionDetails(Map<String,String> transactionDetails, TransactionDetailsCallback callback)
      Called when user confirmation is required prior to proceeding with the Transaction Signing use-case. It is called on the main thread.
      Parameters:
      transactionDetails - A dictionary representation of the transaction details.
      callback - The callback which will be implemented and passed to proceed with or cancel the operation.
      Since:
      1.2.0
